title: Mixed content
summary:
When a web page is loaded from a secure origin, over a secure channel such as HTTPS, the connection with the web server is encrypted, and is therefore protected from eavesdropping and modification by man-in-the-middle attacks.
  If the securely loaded web page only includes images, scripts, and other resources that are also hosted on secure origins, users can be confident that the whole page is safe from these kinds of attacks.
pageTitle: Mixed content - Security on the web | MDN
